thread.title: Builders heard 'very loud bang' days before Tara Palmer-Tomkinson found dead in London flat
thread.title_full: Builders heard 'very loud bang' days before Tara Palmer-Tomkinson found dead in London flat

author: Steve Robson
title: Builders heard 'very loud bang' days before Tara Palmer-Tomkinson found dead in London flat
text:
Tara Palmer-Tomkinson dies aged 45 Share this video Watch Next 
"The trouble is, you don’t feel brilliant. You just feel out of your depth. In fact, if you did feel brilliant, you might not do the toxic things I started to do. 
"Was I self-destructing? Well, let’s face it, narcotics are self-destructive, but no, I certainly didn’t see it that way at the time. I don’t think I was doing anything different to anyone else — it’s just that I was in the papers,” she said. 
“I did things I’m very ashamed of. I put my family through so much. 
"I thought I’d be married and have two children by now. I imagined I’d be living in the country. I’d have my parents’ lifestyle, basically." Tara Palmer Tomkinson on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here (Photo: Rex Features) 
In 2014 she said she had become a recluse after suffering a nervous breakdown and spoke about her battle with drug addiction on ITV show Jeremy Kyle: The Celebrity Specials. 
She broke down in tears as she recalled the night she nearly died from an overdose during her battle with cocaine addiction. 
She eventually quit drugs following a 35-day stint in an Arizona rehab clinic. 
Her father Charles was a former British Olympic skier who instructed Charles and in 1988 her mother Patti was skiing in the Swiss Alps with the Prince when their party was hit by an avalanche which killed the Queen's former equerry, Major Hugh Lindsay, and left Mrs Palmer Tomkinson with serious leg injuries. 
Shocked residents at her former childhood home in Dummer near Basingstoke spoke of their shock at her death tonight. 
Dummer Parish Council chairman Julian Jones stressed:"I am shocked - It is tragic "The whole village will send it's sympathy to the family. She was very well known in the village - she was brought up here." 
He said the last time he remembered seeing her in the village was last summer. 
"I recall she was down last summer "Up until five years ago she was a relatively regular weekend visitor. 
"I had not realised how seriously ill she was. 
"They are a very well known family in the village." 
A number of Bramham Gardens residents said they were shocked and horrified by the news of her death today. 
The blinds were drawn at the flat where Tara lived. 
Neighbours told of how she used drive her silver BMW 645Ci "very fast and furious" down the street. 
But she was hailed as "very sweet" by the local community. Read More 
Anne Swift said: "We always saw her driving very fast and furious in her car, she always lived life to the full. 
"We have a resident's association and she was part of that to a certain extent. 
"As far as I am aware she was living alone." 
Around 16,000 people are diagnosed with brain tumours every year across the UK. 
Brain Tumour Research says fewer than one in five people survive past five years. 
In a series of tributes to her today, showbiz blogger Perez Hilton said he was "so very sad to hear of the all-too-young death" of the brunette model, while socialite Henry Conway tweeted: "We had our differences, but she had a good heart. My condolences to all her family." 
TV presenter and stylist Gok Wan said on Twitter: "So sad to hear of TPT passing away. So young..." 
Christine Hamilton, who clashed with Palmer-Tomkinson on the first series of ITV's jungle-based reality show, wrote: "We had our differences in #IACGMOOH 2002 but what tragic news - RIP vivacious, talented girl." 
Comedian and actress Kathy Burke, star of Harry Enfield and Chums, tweeted simply "RIP TPT" alongside a love heart and photo of the socialite.
